Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of [99m Tc]Tilmanocept in Sentinel Lymph Node Biopsy for Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma

Trial_Design.evidence: Conducted as a multicenter, non-randomized, single-arm trial

Participants.evidence: the study enrolled 101 patients with T1–T4, N0, and M0 HNSCC across 13 centers. Eligibility criteria included no prior neck dissection or radiotherapy.

Intervention.evidence: Patients received 50 µg [99m Tc]tilmanocept radiolabeled with either 0.5 mCi (same day) or 2.0 mCi (next day), followed by lymphoscintigraphy, SLNB, and elective neck dissection (END).

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to determine the false negative rate (FNR) of sentinel lymph node biopsy (SLNB) using [99m Tc]tilmanocept in patients with intraoral or cutaneous head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSCC).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the FNR of SLNB, measured from June 2009 to November 2012.

Number_Randomised.evidence: the study enrolled 101 patients with T1–T4, N0, and M0 HNSCC across 13 centers.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Among 39 patients with tumor-positive nodes, one had a false negative, yielding an FNR of 2.56% (95.03% CI 0.06–13.49; p = 0.0205).

Harms.evidence: No drug-related serious adverse events were reported.

Trial_Registration.evidence: The trial was registered under NCT00911326.
